derivation: from a comparative of G5092 (τιμωρέω) and ouros (a guard);
strongs_def: properly, to protect one's honor, i.e. to avenge (inflict a penalty)
outline:
1. to be a guardian or avenger of honour
    1. to succour, come to the help of
  2. to avenge
  3. in the NT, to take vengeance on one, to punish
